bow: need help with name pregnant with baby girl and due in june my husband and can not for our lives settle on name we like strong er names for girls and are really trying to stay away from the most popular names on all of the lists any suggestions we tend to gravitate towards more old fashioned names like ava eloise cora esther veda and charlotte charlie to name few not sure if those qualify as strong but think they re darn cute good luck charlotte is on our short list agree love the old fashioned names too one of my favorites is hazel husband says it too old fashioned no suggestions but found browsing wikipedia lists to be far more interesting way to search for names glance through lists of authors magicians scientists etc it broke up the monotony of other alphabetical baby name lists and learned fun facts while at it too and we did end up naming our son from an author list that great idea can only handle looking at the same baby name lists for so long without getting completely frustrated alice paul allie for short aubrey was our top girl name have you seen www babynamewizard com when was naming my kids bought the baby name wizard book and it was fantastic you can look up names you like and it gives sister names that have similar style or feeling to them the website also tracks the popularity of names over time has cool lists literary sports names ethnic names etc and is really great resource ve never been to that website before heading there now really like the social security website for baby names you can search most popular names of any year or you can search name and see its popularity ranking throughout the years it will also sort by state or us territory it pretty cool http www ssa gov oact babynames ht=0 like stronger names as well and my favorites are natalie or leah also my own name is kate and it always felt like strong name to me subreddit namenerds is another spot to ask enjoy it hazel is probably going to come back in vogue since the fault in our stars got so popular do know if that positive or negative for you lydia loved the name artemis but my brother just had to steal the name and give it to his daughter before could have girl lol love the name natalie my husband does like it he says it reminds him of natalie portman do really see the issue since she freakin gorgeous my friend has an almost year old with this name annabelle was on our list hazel is big amongst the hipsters around here if you love it go for it let him pick middle name and if it turns out the middle is better fit she can use that or at least that what you tell him until he gets used to the idea namenerds is probably better place to ask this like to use the social security administration website to determine which names are very popular and now to probably offend lot of people my only other help is please stay away from novel spellings they do make your child unique they make them less likely to get call when they submit their resume somewhere thanks going to try there kuvira nova saphira try namenerds aurelia love hazel it so hard to agree on names our year old did have name until day post partum secretary kept calling our room to see if we made decision that great idea looked through movie credits for name ideas old fashioned names have made comeback for sure love hattie for girl like that name is it short for something else all my boys were so easy to name liam oliver graham we re having an impossible time with girls name that beautiful ve posted there too nope just hattie pearl or nora really like carter harper and parker for girl names but my husband did not we ended up with emery grace and then one of our close friend brother and sister in law met us at bbq while she was pregnant they had picked name yet when we introduced them to emery could tell what would happen next yup they stole it and we are in the same school district and they are only months apart so it was very likely they will be in the same class was pissed we worked so hard to give her unique name that we loved and they just took it and now they will share name and most likely will be emery and emery in school now the mother claims they got it out of magazine and had never heard it before and had no idea that is what we named our baby love old fashioned names both my children have older names charles almost and evelyn months charlotte and hazel are both beautiful always consider what nicknames will be associated with the name you choose maybe you can sell you husband on charlotte using the nickname charlie as mentioned above everly sophia fiona olivia claire cleo faith grace rose lily justice amelia june april felicity are all names have on my radar for the next couple deleted we chose maya willow for our daughter maybe it wishful thinking on my part but ve always thought it was strong yet feminine name aubrey is my husbands name funny that back in the day it was popular boys name love it for both nora is adorable right when was pregnant with my first before we found out it was boy we were having trouble coming up with girl name we liked we went to go see thor in theaters and as we were leaving we were talking about how much we liked natalie portman and that when we thought hey how about natalie if it girl of course that was boy and then our second was boy so we did get to use it if we ever get crazy enough to have one more baby and it girl we will absolutely still go with natalie we chose arabella for our daughter and we love it simple and feminine the baby name voyager on this site is one of the best baby name websites imo still play with it just for fun even though done having children also loved her book it helped me find an uncommon name with common nickname which is what wanted beautiful thanks ll check it out my running partner just named her daughter maya lovely name love evelyn my sister just had girl in december and named her nora such pretty name really like emery might steal that one only if it ok with you deleted it super cute actually had family friend just name their son odin like from thor thought it was an interesting name never heard that before really like cassandra and josephine me too we call her evie ev for short though older people tend to pronounce the as eh but not wild about it her middle name is lou so when she gets older can yell evie lou where are you that may or may not be half the reason gave her that middle name haha those are great names oliver was an option for us while we had the first bot and girl name picked out when we were engaged little silly know when we discussed what our second baby name would be if it were boy we were stumped think we were leaning towards james but luckily we had girl both those names are quite popular right now unfortunately but fortunately because everyone wants more unique name even the top 10 names are less common than they used to be haven seconded to make our list when was pregnant with we went to the lists from the 1920s and 30s it was cool to see names that fell out of popularity but are still recognized and not wacky have you tried nymbler com you can put in inspiration names and it will give you suggestions that are similar in style named my daughter emeri but obviously spelt it with an instead of geez never knew anyone else knew of that name my friend almost named her daughter that too her daughter is month and half older then mine after she heard the name from me as well but it did go well with her last name thank goodness would of been pissed just like you if she stole it soo pissed ve liked that name for like years so get it lol find nice cemetary and go for long walk looking at all the names it may seem morbid but you can think of it as drawing inspiration from their legacy maple opal helena good luck maybe variation like emerson or emily suggest looking at family names what are both of your mothers names what are the four grandmothers names aunts names middle names too my suggestion is that if you really like one name like maybe his grandma name then use middle name from your grandma to balance it out if that fails like the names hattie and trudy so ll suggest those to you hazel is nice heard on the radio the other day that charlotte is the most popular name for girls here new zealand and one of the top ten in the world not sure if that something that would drive you closer or push you away just interesting it already on the way back in know two people with little girls named hazel and there was just an article george takei posted on facebook few weeks ago on old fashioned names making comeback and hazel was on that short list not saying picking popular name is the end of the world though and actually according to social security name data http www ssa gov cgi bin babyname cgi hazel was still just 157 last year however when chose my son name it had been ranked about 120 the year before when checked it his birth year it was 100 should have noticed it was climbing in popularity because now it in the top 50 again not the end of the world but when we go to the park or something there is often young child there with his same name knew little girl emery and she was the most gorgeous thing ever it was top name on my list also after talking to some of my friends they ve gotten really annoyed with having to spell their names out all the time for everything even just to get starbucks think it beautiful name but most girl names these days start with an or an think she said she wants something that not too trendy in the 2000s so far the top 15 names have included emily emma abigail ashley alexis alyssa and ava when we go to sports activities with our kids it very hard to keep the girls names straight because there will be like girls and of them have names like arella elly emma aubrey emmy ella etc think it this decade version of all the mc names of the 90s like makayla makenzie and mckenna like the name sadie do too it could totally stand alone yes this is my favorite older names sound interesting without being weird current favorites for girls are cora and hazel this is how we got name inspiration we ended up finding more about our family story and settled on classic meaningful name lots of unconventional ones in there too britton was popular family name for while was ready for that though steal away we stole it from my husbands moms friend but they live 800 miles away so we thought it was ok it only irks because they will be in the same class in school elizabeth victoria claudia eleanor beatrice amelia olivia cordelia audrey caroline moira bernadette constance vivian rebecca matilda natalie eloise astrid jacqueline veronica we totally have the opposite problem we get stuck on boy names we ended up with august it actually short for harriet we wanted normal but not overused named so we crossed off the first 75 names and went from there my husband has super common name and there were others in his class in school so we wanted to avoid that and the social security site definitely helped as someone who always had to spell their name even though mine is the original and most common too many others had to be unique it so annoying and now my daughter will have to spell hers because people have begun crazy variations of her name too as business person those resumes do do as well
